item.title: DEFCON 31: Retrospective
item.description: Beginning Back in October of 2019, I was attending my 3rd/4th? year at UBC, where I tried to play in a beginner-friendly CTF known as “CSAW 2019” with UBC’s team: Maple Bacon. Particularly, I tried out a challenge called Unagi, which, having spent an eternity on, I managed to solve after hours of wrangling with the problem. To be completely frank, I solved the challenge after googling “XML vulnerability” and trying out payloads - really, just, throwing payloads and modifying them to tailor the challenge - until one stuck and I got the flag.
